In vain my fond heart seeks for ease,</br>Nor ever, I fear, will have rest;</br>Not beauty, nor harmony please;</br>Sad care is corroding my breast.
The prospects that gladden the field</br>With many inspire the gay song;</br>But to me no such pleasure they yield;</br>When the heart's not at ease, all seems wrong.
I have stray'd through the city and town,</br>And enquired wherever I went;</br>Tell me, youths, (although I'm a clown)</br>Have ye seen such a lass as CONTENT?
"CONTENT, they replied, lives not here;</br>Go, shepherd, return home again;</br>Perhaps, with fair FREEDOM and EASE,</br>She carelessly sports on yon plain."
I will give the best lamb in my fold,</br>If you'll tell me which way 'tis she went;</br>I'd value not silver or gold;</br>All I wish for is beauteous CONTENT.</br>
